00011 EZCutter::EZCutter() : SuperCutter() {
00012

00022 void
00023 EZCutter::setCamera( int npix, int utdate ) {
00024 
00025     delete _cam;
00026     _cam = new Camera(npix,utdate);
00027

00030 
00038 void
00039 EZCutter::
00040 applyCorrections(HillasParameterization &param) {
00041 
00042     double dx,dy, cfact;
00043     
00044     // constants from fits to simulated data. The functional form for
00045     // width and length is as follows:
00046     //
00047     // f(f',x) = [( sqrt(f'^2-A^2) + B(x-C) + E(x-C)^2 + F(x-C)^3)^2 *
00048     // (cos(60)^COSPOW)/(cos(60)^\gamma) * cos(zenith)^\gamma +
00049     // A]^(1/2) where x is the log(size) and f' is the zwidth or
00050     // zlength value.  The function has to be inverted to convert from
00051     // width -> zwidth.  D is the fitted mean f' value from simulations. 
00052    
00053     const double WA = 0.003;
00054     const double WB = 0.04679;
00055     const double WC = 9.866;
00056     const double WD = 0.1832;
00057     const double WE = 0.01534;
00058     const double WF = 0.00248;
00059     const double WGAMMA = 0.949;
00060     const double WCOSPOW = 1.5;
00061 
00062     const double LA = 0.003;
00063     const double LB = 0.0792;
00064     const double LC = 9.867;
00065     const double LD = 0.3023;
00066     const double LE = 0.02700;
00067     const double LF = 0.00374;
00068     const double LGAMMA = 0.714;
00069     const double LCOSPOW = 1.2;
00070 
00071     double zen; 
00072 
00073     HillasParameterization oldparam = param; //for debugging
00074     zen = param.zenith;
00075     
00076     //============================================================
00077     // First, apply camera gain correction (PE/DC)
00078     //============================================================
00079 
00080     // l/s must be corrected after PE to DC correction, but before
00081     // zenith angle
00082 
00083     param.max[0] *= _cam->getPEToDC();
00084     param.max[1] *= _cam->getPEToDC();
00085     param.max[2] *= _cam->getPEToDC();
00086     param.size   *= _cam->getPEToDC();
00087     param.length_over_size = (param.length/(double)(param.size)); 
00088 
00089     //============================================================
00090     // Calculate ezwidth , ezlength
00091     //============================================================
00092 
00093     const double cos60 = cos(60.0*M_PI/180.0);
00094     double ezwidth2, ezlength2;
00095     double ezwidth, ezlength, wzenithfactor,lzenithfactor;
00096     double x,wshift2,lshift2,lterm1,wterm1;
00097     
00098     wzenithfactor = ( (pow(cos60, WGAMMA)/pow(cos60,WCOSPOW)) 
00099                             /pow( cos(zen), WGAMMA ));
00100 
00101     lzenithfactor = ( (pow(cos60, LGAMMA)/pow(cos60,LCOSPOW))
00102                              /pow( cos(zen), LGAMMA ));
00103     x=log(param.size/0.4489); // need to divide out .4489 since fit
00104                               // values assume 490 camera with no
00105                               // corrections
00106 
00107 
00108     wshift2 = param.width*param.width - WA;
00109     wterm1 = (wshift2*wzenithfactor>1e-20)? 
00110         sqrt(wshift2*wzenithfactor): 1e-20;
00111 
00112     ezwidth2 = WA + pow( wterm1 - WB*(x-WC) - WE*pow(x-WC,2) 
00113                             - WF*pow(x-WC,3) ,2 );
00114     ezwidth = (ezwidth2>0.0)? sqrt(ezwidth2) : 0.0;
00115 
00116     // ---- zlength
00117 
00118     lshift2 = param.length*param.length - LA;
00119     lterm1 = (lshift2*lzenithfactor>1e-20)? 
00120         sqrt(lshift2*lzenithfactor) :1e-20;
00121     
00122     ezlength2 = LA + pow( lterm1 - LB*(x-LC) - LE*pow(x-LC,2) 
00123                              - LF*pow(x-LC,3) ,2 );
00124 
00125     ezlength = (ezlength2>0.0)? sqrt(ezlength2) : 0.0;
00126     
00127     cout.precision(5);
00128 //     cout << "DEBUG: width: "<<setw(8)<<param.width
00129 //       << " size: "<< setw(8) << param.size 
00130 //       << " x: "<< setw(8) << x
00131 //       << " ezwidth: "<<setw(8)<<ezwidth
00132 //       << " lzfact: "<<setw(8)<<lzenithfactor
00133 //       << " length: "<<setw(8)<<param.length
00134 //       << " ezlength2: "<<setw(8)<<ezlength2
00135 //       << " ezlength: "<<setw(8)<<ezlength
00136 //       << endl;
00137 
00138 
00139     //============================================================    
00140     // Correct the 2D points 
00141     //============================================================
00142 
00143     double newelongation;
00144 
00145     // First calculate the distance between the point of origin and
00146     // centroid
00147 
00148     dx = param.point_of_origin_a.x - param.centroid.x;
00149     dy = param.point_of_origin_a.y - param.centroid.y;
00150 
00151     // Now calculate the correction factor including two terms: the
00152     // first ratio corrects the elongation factor, the second replaces
00153     // the width/length (elongation) dependence with the intrinsic
00154     // elongation given by zwidth/zlength
00155 
00156     // KPK: the elongation factor is now a function of x=ln(size), fit
00157     // from simulations.  e(x) = 1.0894 + 0.092611*x.  Here x
00158     // shouldn't be divided by 0.4489 because the correction factor
00159     // was already applied in the simulations!
00160     
00161     x = log(param.size);
00162     newelongation = 1.0894 + 0.092611*x;
00163 
00164     // correct the old point of origin based on the new elongation factor:
00165     // the Parameterizer always assumes a elongation factor of 1.68. 
00166 
00167     cfact = (newelongation / 1.68) *  // TODO: 1.68 shouldn't be hardcoded!
00168         ((1.0-ezwidth/ezlength)/(1.0-param.width/param.length));
00169     
00170     // Modified by JB 030201 should just add the rescaled distance
00171     // from centroid to point of origin to the orignal centroid
00172     // position for point a, subtract fo point b
00173 
00174     param.point_of_origin_a.x = param.centroid.x + cfact*dx;
00175     param.point_of_origin_a.y = param.centroid.y + cfact*dy;
00176 
00177     param.point_of_origin_b.x = param.centroid.x - cfact*dx;
00178     param.point_of_origin_b.y = param.centroid.y - cfact*dy;
00179 
00180     //============================================================
00181     // set all the values
00182     //============================================================
00183     
00184     // note miss is also scaled by cos(theta) in case somebody wants
00185     // to re-calculate alpha from miss and distance later.
00186     
00187     param.width = ezwidth;
00188     param.length = ezlength;
00189 //  param.distance /= cos(zen); // from now on, don't correct distance
00190                                 //  (it's not needed)
00191     param.miss /= cos(zen);
00192 
00193 
00194 }
00195
